title: Pan-Seared Steak

instructions: Press gently to remove surface moisture.
Ensure both sides are completely dry.
Sprinkle coarse salt evenly on both sides.
Lightly pat seasoning to help it adhere.
Heat a pan on high until very hot.
Add a small amount of olive oil.
Place steak into pan without moving it.
Flip once a crust has formed.
Let it rest for at least 5 minutes.
Slice and serve once juices redistribute.

tips: Dry steak gives a stronger sear and better crust.
Do not flip too early — wait until it naturally releases from the pan.
Resting prevents juices from leaking out when slicing.
